intro: Ibicella lutea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
